DOC.brief_summary: It is unclear whether a topical pharyngeal anesthesia adds any benefit to the upper gastrointestinal endoscopy under a propofol sedation. We hypothesize that a topical pharyngeal anesthesia does not ease the upper gastrointestinal endoscopy under propofol sedation. The aim of this study is therefore to quantify the impact of a topical pharyngeal anesthesia to the upper gastrointestinal endoscopy in patients sedated with propofol. Patients will be randomized to receive a topical pharyngeal spray containing either an anesthetic drug (lidocaine 10%) or a placebo. Thereafter the upper endoscopy will be conducted in its standard manner.
DOC.brief_title: Propofol Sedation During Upper Endoscopy With and Without Topical Pharyngeal Anesthesia
DOC.criteria: Scheduled diagnostic upper endoscopy Wish to be sedated ASA class I III Signed informed consent Emergency medical examinations Therapeutic Endoscopy ASA class IV Pregnancy Known allergy to propofol or lidocaine
